At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡ > Settings

Type 'config editor' into the search field (without the quotes).

content:
In the absence of any responses, I took the bull by the horns and downloaded the latest version of TB (115.2.0 (64 bit)) and installed it on my wife's PC. Low and behold, it seems to have fixed the problems outlined above, which begs two questions: why did her old version of TB not update automatically as dictated by the settings and why did nobody on this forum steer me in the right direction?

The second question is rather disappointing.

Regards to all

Phil
creator: phil37

content:
After checking everything again it seems that changing the Identification Method is working, I guess we don't need OAuth2 anymore for some reason and it's just breaking TB into an infinite loop of asking for you to login.

The thread/post can be closed.

content: Hi Wayne. No accounts show. On opening thunderbird it takes me straight to create your new email accounts so I have to re-enter all my details..... What I did yesterday is uninstall thunderbird, remove any remnants of thunderbird directories/files and install a fresh(virgin) installation "supernova 115.2.2 (64-bit)".. I've then re-entered all my email accounts.. Today (18/09/23) I checked the pref.js file by confirming the byte count which was as it was yesterday post the re-entering of email accounts. I opened up thunderbird and everything was there..... time will tell will update in a few days.. thanks for your input.

content: What are you trying to achieve in the first place? Note, Thunderbird supports CardDAV natively, and it uses OAuth2 authentication. You'll have to use your main Google account password for this, no app password is needed.
creator: christ1

content:
I have downloaded Thunderbird and try to get use of my different mail-accounts, and Gmail gives me problems.

I have followed the instructions from Mozilla: "As of May 30, 2022, Google will no longer support access for less secure apps to Gmail accounts, so OAuth is required. If you use Google-supplied "app passwords", Thunderbird version 91.8.0 and later versions will do the conversion to OAuth for you. Additionally, Gmail accounts do not work with Thunderbird version 31 and earlier because they do not support Google's OAuth (implemented in bug 849540)."

And I can se that Thunderbird try to connect with OAuth2 - see attached

I have tryed the Google generated password as well as my normal - same result!

content:
In my case, my Hotmail (Outlook with hotmail.com address) account seemed to automatically change from "Normal Password" to "OAuth2", and changing it back to "Normal password" made it start working again. I have another account that's an outlook.com and it wasn't changed.

I don't think personal email even supports OAuth, but perhaps the Thunderbird team thought because Microsoft is moving all school & business accounts there that they would be "helpful" and automatically move my account to OAuth, despite that it definitely is a personal account and not associated with an organisation.

content:
George Wimmer <georgewwimmer@gmail.com> 4:54 PM (2 hours ago) to no-reply

I have all these labels that showed up under each email account. I just want to see my 3 email accounts. I do not want to have “drafts “, “sent”, “sent mail”, “spam”, “trash”, “all mail”, “important “, and “starred “ showing up under each email account. How do I make these labels go away and get back to the simple 3 account view that I used to have for so many years (since Eudora)?

Is there a way to go back to the previous simplified version? 

Thanks
creator: geowimmer

content:
I understand - I've gotten very accustomed to the old way myself. However, arguably, these should have behaved like other account types from the start and not been hidden. They are now "flattened" like all other accounts. There is no going back.

But you can unsubscribe from All Mail for example. In the google settings you might be able to hide some.
creator: wsmwk

content: The issue is not wanting to get rid of any of these folders, but to be able to 'fold' them under a single entry like 'gmail' as it was previously. Previously, I would periodically check my spam folder and drafts folder and occasionally use 'sent' or 'all mail' to search for an email. This issue is that I do not want to lose the space for each account. It should be noted that I track 4 gmail accounts and having 5 instead of a single entry for each one takes up too much vertical space unnecessarily. Please provide an option to condense these to a single line as in previous versions.

content:
Yes, I stated that in my original post: "Not all accounts show up in unified folders, although all accounts are visible in the "All folders" view."

I'll add here that 1 only account is missing in 1 profile, 8 of 17 accounts are missing in another profile, but ALL accounts are missing from "Unified folders" in a third profile.
creator: moz1

content:
I had a similar problem when T-Bird auto-updated to 115.3.1. In my case, I was missing one of five email accounts from the unified inbox. Thankfully, I was able to fix this by right-clicking the unified inbox and selecting "Properties", and then "Choose", which allowed me to select what accounts to include in the unified folder. I still don't know why that one account got dropped from the folder in the process of updating T-Bird, but this seems to have fixed it.

-Bill
creator: bill209

content:
I UN-checked the All Folders flag but left the Unified Folders flag set and I got the Inbox results that I wanted. Each folder (Inbox, Drafts, Sent, etc.) now included emails from my the accounts. 

I hope this helps.

Various combinations of folder views makes no difference either.

creator: wsmwk

content:
• Install https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/unified-folders-debugging/
  • on the Unified Folders heading click on ⋮ three vertical dots
  • click Debugging Info
  • scroll to bottom
  • do Copy to Clipboard and save the clipboard somewhere
  • click Close.
  • in the Unified Folders heading click on ⋮ three vertical dots, and do "Reset Unified Folders". (DO THIS LAST)

Does that help?
creator: wsmwk

content:
Thanks, Wayne. That solved the problem, which was apparent in the debugging info in that 8 of the 17 folder were not listed as having their "inbox" selected under "Smart Folders". Resetting did the job. I got the normal search options window back (see attached).

That being said, it's still not the same as before the update. A big difference now is that all the subfolders under "Inbox" are incorporated into Unified Folders (search) by default. This never used to be the case. Now I need to go in and delete the extra folders that I don't want showing up (49 in this particular profile - it will be hundreds in my largest profile). The Dovecot/Exim mailserver apparently includes all additional folders under the Inbox, unlike some other email programs. So I would suggest excluding these folders by default.

I'd also suggest that the programmers incorporate this functionality into Thunderbird, rather than have it exist as an add-on.

I hope this answer helps some others who have had the same issues.

creator: wsmwk

content:
If only unified folders is the problem then

  1. open the troubleshooting information on the help menu.
  2. Click the show profile button
  3. Close Thunderbird
  4. Open the "mail" folder in the file manager window that opened.
  5. Delete the folder named "smart mailboxes"
  6. Restart Thunderbird.

content: It's possible to print a selected portion of a message. In the Print dialog, show More settings and click Selection under Format (see picture).
creator: sfhowes

content: Hi, thank you for your reply.. I have searched high and low and do not have any option that shows "format" in my print menu. A bit odd, can anyone else help me please?
creator: dph2107

content:
The picture in my reply appears after you select Print... from the menu.

You can always select the desired portion, then copy it (Ctrl+C) and paste into Notepad (Ctrl+V), and print from Notepad.
creator: sfhowes

content: When you select View/Folders/Unified Folders, All Folders is already checked, so select View/Folders again and uncheck All Folders.
creator: sfhowes

content: That sounded promising, but in fact All Folders wasn't checked. I tried several rounds of checking/rechecking/restarting in the hopes it would all reset, but that didn't work. I should be clear (see image) that this is not a separate window in the folders pane (like All Folders), but duplication within the Unified Folders view.
creator: bma.query

content:
You can try the standard steps to repair Unified View: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete virtualFolders.dat and the Mail/smart mailboxes subfolder. Restart TB and select Unified Folders view.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Unified_Folders_not_working
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks. I tried this twice - the second time having set the view to All Folders only first - but no success. Maybe because I'm using Local Folders, I should have deleted Mail/Local Folders? Except that seems to have some content - oddly, only for one of the five mail accounts, but that's the only one with sub-subfolders (Account/Level 1/Level 2), so maybe that's why.
creator: bma.query

content: Just delete the smart mailboxes subfolder of Mail, not Mail/Local Folders.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks. I did try that (twice) with no success.
creator: bma.query

content:
Instead of applying Unified view, you might get better results by creating Saved Searches (File/New/Saved Search...). Unified is just a type of saved search.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Saved_Search
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks. I'll look into that. It is disappointing, though, that this new version of TB requires me to jump through such hoops just to get back to where I was. I'm sure it's better in many ways I haven't seen, but for me, so far, it's a step back.
creator: bma.query

content:
There are some Unified view fixes in the next release, 115.2.3, probably within a week:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1847401#c14

Candidate builds are already available.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Is the folder pane and the message list pane are blank? Then the pane system did not initialize. We find so far that users have a folder that causing the problem, and the name of the folder will likely be shown in the error console. Check tools > developer > error console for errors (not warnings) about folders or panes. Please post what you find.

If only unified folders is the problem then

  1. open the troubleshooting information on the help menu.
  2. Click the show profile button
  3. Close Thunderbird
  4. Open the "mail" folder in the file manager window that opened.
  5. Delete the folder named "smart mailboxes"
  6. Restart Thunderbird.
creator: wsmwk

content: Which views/layouts do you have enabled? And which item isn't working/missing?
creator: wsmwk

content: My issue is not related to inaility to use the program. My issue is that the redesign of the home screen did nothing for performance. You just moved things around on the screen causing a new learning curve to find where you moved things. As I said CHANGE FOR THE SAKE OF CHANGE is a waste of developer time. If you are not improving performance or adding a new function there is not reason to FIX WHAT AINT BROKE. I worked in IT for 47 years in every aspect and area, computer operator, JCL expert, auto-scheduling, programming (COBOL, PL1, ASIST, SQL, SQL Server), Mainframe, web based design and documentation, etc. I never wasted time making things "prettier".
creator: white134098

content:
https://blog.thunderbird.net/category/thunderbird/ in case you want to see some background.

I've worked in IT for 43 years with all kinds of hardware and software (most of the items you cite), so I well understand concern about change for change sake. In this situation, it's not gratuitous change. It's ground up rewriting so that in future months and years we can move to the next steps of building more power, performance and capabilities into the product. Without version 115's changes this would not be possible.
creator: wsmwk

content: What version number is shown in Help > More Troubleshooting Information.
creator: wsmwk

content: If you are using Unified Folders with version 115 there is a bug. Some fixes are coming.
creator: wsmwk
